data.title: The Best Bands Like Pink Floyd
data.meta_description: Over 200 music fans have voted on the 30+ Best Bands Like Pink Floyd. Current Top 3: The Alan Parsons Project, King Crimson, The Moody Blues
data.text:
The Alan Parsons Project is yet another stellar addition to the list of bands like Pink Floyd - a connection that runs deep, considering that Alan Parsons himself was the audio engineer for Pink Floyd's "Dark Side of the Moon." The Alan Parsons Project's music exudes a cinematic quality, taking listeners on a journey through atmospheric soundscapes, complex arrangements, and intelligent lyrics. Pink Floyd enthusiasts will find much to love in the Project's exploration of human experiences and emotions, wrapped in an undeniably captivating musical package.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From The Alan Parsons Project

- "Eye in the Sky"

- "Games People Play"

- "Time"

Dive Into The Alan Parsons Project's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "The Turn of a Friendly Card"

- "Pyramania"

When discussing bands like Pink Floyd, it's impossible not to mention the pioneers of progressive rock, King Crimson. Their debut album, "In the Court of the Crimson King," is a mesmerizing journey through epic soundscapes, intricate melodies, and thought-provoking lyrics that parallel Pink Floyd's most iconic works. Fans of Pink Floyd will undoubtedly appreciate King Crimson's ambitious experimentation with various musical textures and their unwavering commitment to pushing the boundaries of rock music.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From King Crimson

- "21st Century Schizoid Man"

- "I Talk to the Wind"

- "Epitaph"

Dive Into King Crimson's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "Islands"

- "Fracture"

In the pantheon of classic progressive rock bands, The Moody Blues hold a special place for their pioneering fusion of rock and classical music. Albums like their masterpiece "Days of Future Passed" share the introspective, dream-like quality that makes Pink Floyd's music so mesmerizing. Fans of Pink Floyd will enjoy the lush orchestration and thought-provoking lyrics that have become synonymous with The Moody Blues' unique brand of music.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From The Moody Blues

- "Nights in White Satin"

- "Tuesday Afternoon"

- "Your Wildest Dreams"

Dive Into The Moody Blues' History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "Dawning is the Day"

- "The Actor"

Hailing from the same era as Pink Floyd, Supertramp is often cited as one of the leading British progressive rock bands of the 1970s. Fans of Pink Floyd will find much to love in Supertramp's blend of introspective lyrics, catchy melodies, and virtuosic musicianship. Their masterpiece, "Crime of the Century," is laden with songs that explore existential themes, captivating arrangements, and soaring instrumentals that reach the same emotional heights as Pink Floyd's most celebrated works.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From Supertramp

- "Breakfast in America"

- "The Logical Song"

- "Take the Long Way Home"

Dive Into Supertramp's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "A Soapbox Opera"

- "Child of Vision"

As a contemporary progressive rock band influenced by the likes of Pink Floyd, Porcupine Tree has earned a dedicated following for their evocative, atmospheric music. Founder and creative force Steven Wilson is well known for his love of Pink Floyd's oeuvre, as evidenced in Porcupine Tree's ambitious concept albums, intricate arrangements, and introspective lyrics. Albums such as "In Absentia" and "Fear of a Blank Planet" are essential listening for any Pink Floyd fan interested in exploring the modern reimagining of their beloved genre.

Rock Out To Some Of The Most Popular Songs From Porcupine Tree

- "Trains"

- "Lazarus"

- "Anesthetize"

Dive Into Porcupine Tree's History With Some Unique Deep Cuts

- "Arriving Somewhere But Not Here"

- "Cheating the Polygraph"
